put.description: Creates a new Batch account with the specified parameters. Existing accounts cannot be updated with this API and should instead be updated with the Update Batch Account API.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the new Batch account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: A name for the Batch account which must be unique within the region. Batch account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and must use only numbers and lowercase letters. This name is used as part of the DNS name that is used to access the Batch service in the region in which the account is created. For example: http://accountname.region.batch.azure.com/.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Additional parameters for account creation.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the Batch account entity.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

Location.description: The URL of the resource used to check the status of the asynchronous operation.

Retry-After.description: Suggested delay to check the status of the asynchronous operation. The value is an integer that represents the seconds.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the properties of an existing Batch account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the account.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Additional parameters for account update.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the Batch account entity.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account to be deleted.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the account to be deleted.

202.description: The operation will be completed asynchronously.

Location.description: The URL of the resource used to check the status of the asynchronous operation.

Retry-After.description: Suggested delay to check the status of the asynchronous operation. The value is an integer that represents the seconds.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: The name of the account.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the Batch account entity.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the Batch accounts associated with the subscription.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of Batch account entities associated with the subscription.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the Batch accounts associated within the specified resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group whose Batch accounts to list.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains a list of Batch account entities associated with the resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Synchronizes access keys for the auto storage account configured for the specified Batch account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Batch account.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerates the specified account key for the Batch account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the account.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The type of key to regenerate.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the keys of the Batch account.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Gets the account keys for the specified Batch account.
post.description: This operation applies only to Batch accounts created with a poolAllocationMode of 'BatchService'. If the Batch account was created with a poolAllocationMode of 'UserSubscription', clients cannot use access to keys to authenticate, and must use Azure Active Directory instead. In this case, getting the keys will fail.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the account.

200.description: The operation was successful. The response contains the keys of the Batch account.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the Batch account.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The name of the Batch account.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the application.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the application to activate.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the request.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

storageAccountId.description: The resource ID of the storage account to be used for auto storage account.

AutoStorageBaseProperties.description: The properties related to auto storage account.

autoStorage.description: The properties related to auto storage account.

poolAllocationMode.title: The allocation mode to use for creating pools in the Batch account.
poolAllocationMode.description: The pool allocation mode also affects how clients may authenticate to the Batch Service API. If the mode is BatchService, clients may authenticate using access keys or Azure Active Directory. If the mode is UserSubscription, clients must use Azure Active Directory. The default is BatchService.

keyVaultReference.description: A reference to the Azure key vault associated with the Batch account.

BatchAccountBaseProperties.description: The properties of a Batch account.

autoStorage.description: The properties related to auto storage account.

tags.description: The user specified tags associated with the account.

url.description: The Url of the Azure key vault associated with the Batch account.

storageAccountId.description: The resource ID of the storage account to be used for auto storage account.

activeJobAndJobScheduleQuota.title: The active job and job schedule quota for this Batch account.

value.description: The collection of returned Batch accounts.

format.description: The format of the application package binary file.

packages.description: The list of packages under this application.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

Resource.description: A definition of an Azure resource.

PoolAllocationMode.description: The allocation mode for creating pools in the Batch account.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

target.description: The target of the particular error. For example, the name of the property in error.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

CloudError.description: An error response from the Batch service.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: A unique identifier of a Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to be used with the HTTP request.
